lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, welcome to the fifth episode of Critical Role! Before we start and get into the videos for our initial intro, let me go over a couple of things for the evening. First off, we're shooting to get to 1,500 subscribers by this evening, and as soon as we get there, we're giving out a promo kit that's worth about $250, which is awesome. We'll all go ahead and sign it at the end of the day and get it out to you as well. Also, Tabletop Day is coming up this Saturday, and a few of us will be showing up during the stream as well and any of you guys playing your own tabletop games at home, or whatever the case may be, if you go to the website and register, for each person that registers, we're giving away a boardgame to the charity Big Brothers and Big Sisters, so that's a really, really cool thing that you guys should get involved with. That's this Saturday, at International Tabletop Day, and also, we received a present apparently from the audience.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know vat zis present eez, but now I get to open zis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is for all of us, apparently.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of sack is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a big-- oh, it is a gigantic sack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god guys, this is, this is amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's amazing, as we now have for the group, a castle Greyskull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway guys, welcome to Critical Role, let's get into those intros, shall we?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: After that, they were the best of friends, a rather unlikely pair. Little did she know that in a few years' time, Grog would soon return the favor and bring her back from the clutches of death. After being killed in battle, Pike felt angry. She wanted to be stronger, so that it would never happen again. She spent four months at sea, training with the men and women aboard a ship called The Broken Howl. Gripping her holy symbol in one hand, and her morningstar in the other, this time, Pike is ready.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A creature of impulse, Grog felt only pity for this terrified little thing. His disobedience cost him dearly. Beaten bloody and banished by the herd leader, his uncle Kevdak, Grog was abandoned and left to die. Exiled from his herd, it was then that the relative of the very gnome he fought to save, saved him. It was the kindness of a gnome cleric named Pike that healed Grog, bringing him back from death's edge. And they have remained close friends ever since. Most nights, Grog can be found challenging entire taverns to wrestling matches! Or accompanying Scanlan to the nearest house where you pay for lady favors. Also ale.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Part of the Aramente is proving yourself a strong warrior, a valiant protector, and a wise and compassionate leader. With this knowledge, one thought plays in repeat in her mind: is she even worthy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When he awoke, Percy began to design his first gun. (gunshot)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you haven't heard of Scanlan Shorthalt? Well, gird your loins, ladies, because he has his eye on you. A talented musician, master of disguise, and dashingly handsome in his own mind, Scanlan sings songs almost as much as he sings his own praises. Born a poor gnome, Scanlan used his endless charm and soaring tenor voice to croon for coin and support his single mother. One day, he was discovered by a half-orc promoter, and joined Dr. Dranzel's Spectacular Traveling Troupe, where he learned the ways of the world and honed his skills as a bard extraordinaire. A loner much of his life, Scanlan has never quite come to terms with the violent death of his mother at the hands of a goblin invasion. While his years on the road provided many, shall we say, educational experiences with the opposite sex, deep down Scanlan yearns for the one thing he's never known: the true love of a fellow gnome. Still, Scanlan considers himself a lover first, performer second, and fighter distant third. On the battlefield, he'll support his allies, but rarely draws blood unless it's to protect fellow gnome, Pike. Count on Scanlan for a hearty laugh, a rollicking song, and a twinkle in his eye that melts hearts and makes the females swoon.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Greetings and salutations. I am Tiberius Stormwind. I hail from a town called Ty'rex, located in the heart of Draconia, born from a politically respected family. At the age of 15, I succeeded in passing the Sorcerer's Rite, showing prodigy-like control of my magic. The judges and the Draconian High Council were amazed at how powerful my spells were for how long I had been training. At 20 years old, I was the youngest appointed member of the Magic Guild in Draconian history. For the next few years, I almost went mad from the malaise of being a guild member, as it's rather boring. However, one day I happened upon a chamber, unused for quite some time. In the room were stacks of books and maps of the surrounding cities and areas around the known world. For months I would frequent the chamber, and learned of artifacts from legend. After a long period of research, I made a list of artifacts that caught my eye. I brought these findings to the High Council and was told that all of the information in the chamber I had stumbled upon was either believed to be fiction, or unsolvable mysteries, and hence were lost forever. I found those answers to be unacceptable. A year later, I devised a ruse and managed to convince the city council to lend support in me leaving Draconia on a mission of peace and diplomacy for the surrounding kingdoms, going from town to town and making friends and allies, in and for the name of Draconia. Being a red dragonborn, I had quite the task on my hands in that respect, but it was exactly what I needed so I could explore the world and find these artifacts, as I felt the truth was out there. Some may describe me as buffoonish, but I say poppycock to all that. I am much sharper than most give me credit for. I just don't pay attention to things sometimes. I've also been known to be rather cunning, loyal, happy-go-lucky, and well, dangerous. I can't help but show my true scales every now and then. But overall, I think I'm quite friendly for a dragonborn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never entirely welcome in the company of elves or men, Vax'ildan learned at a young age to skip past formality, preferring instead to invite himself in your door. Along with twin sister Vex'ahlia, Vax was born by a chance encounter between elven royalty and human peasantry. Raised by their mother in their early years, the twins were eventually sent off to their father in the elven capital of Syngorn, but their cool reception among the elves there never warmed, and their time in the capital didn't last. The siblings stole away one autumn night and set out on the open road. After a few years of wandering, they eventually decided to return to their mother, and journeyed back to the lands of their youth. But instead of finding their childhood home, they returned to a pile of rubble. Their mother was gone, their home burned to ash. Pressing the townspeople for answers, they learned of the day the dragon came. With their ties all severed, Vax'ildan and his sister set out to find their fortune together in Tal'Dorei. An outsider since birth, Vax quickly learned to solve life's challenges in his own particular way, often by sidestepping them entirely. And when his knack for circumventing adversity isn't enough, the way of blades the elves schooled him in more than makes up the difference.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was at the age of ten when the two were taken from their mother, and brought to live in Syngorn, the isolated elven city for which their father was an ambassador. He quietly took them in, but always kept an icy distance, and after too many years of disdainful looks, the pair decided to leave his indifference behind, and set out on their own. Vax took to the cities, stealing small trinkets and learning the ways of the thief, while Vex kept to the woods. She preferred the isolation. Always the keen observer, she learned to hunt and to track, to spy and to shoot. And through a series of fateful events, earned herself a companion in the form of a bear, her own stolen Trinket, to fight alongside her and protect her fiercely. Also, he is adorable and gives expert massages.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, guys. So we finally have Pike's video finished, so I hope you got to enjoy that. As a heads-up, too, unfortunately we're going to be down one Scanlan due to work, but that's okay, the bard will be in our hearts this evening, and you're welcome to tweet at him angrily to make sure he makes the next session.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- threw a bucket of goblin shit into the face of the one mind flayer--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- after which, Vax bisected it, pretty much, in one surprise round of attacks that led to a large battle in the center of this building, partway through which ground began to rumble. And then digging a forth from underneath, a bulette, a gargantuan armored, burrowing creature that was hungry and very dangerous that then made the battle that much more intense. A heavy, blood-filled battle later, involved with Percy getting his hand caught and firing his gun into the gullet of the beast, eventually it had its armor pulled apart and was defeated by the party. The remnants of the duergar army inside of this building have been destroyed, aside from a few stragglers who have laid their weapons down, and the general now lies beaten, on his knees before the rest of the party. And that is where we pick up and begin. So, as you all are catching your breath, breathing heavily, as the adrenaline slowly leaves the system. Looking around this building, with the large hole still glaring through the roof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The general's on the ground, warhammer at his side, blackened armor still kind of sizzling with the arcane energy from his temporary Banishment via Scanlan. He sits there with this kind of gnarled, brackish beard, looking about the rest of you with these wild kind of white-coated eyes. "So you found your way in. What's your purpose? What do you want from me?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, Vax walks right up to him and walks behind him and grabs him by the hair, and right back to this position. Let's have a talk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you care to have a chat?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course I would, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you want blood, take it. It's all you're getting from me."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on a second, ask the question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're looking for a halfling. Have you seen one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know what you're talking about."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A female halfling. She came down here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, she wouldn't have gotten far if she did. Not with my people."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take my dagger and stick it in about a centimeter and say, your master is gone, it's just you and your friends here now, I think it's in your best interest to talk. You could walk away from here. You don't have to die if you can play nicely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intimidation roll with advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First roll of the night. First roll of the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably those eight miles you rode.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're welcome to go for her there."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I mean, is there any particular shortcuts or less running into your kind along the way, I suppose?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I highly doubt it." He spits in your direction.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! Prestidigitation. And I catch it and throw it back into his face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check to see if he's lying about that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we have some prisoners to free or something as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does not appear to be lying about his interpretation of her, apparently she is where he is. As to where her current state is, you don't know, but he seems to have a very, very made-up mind as to her possibility of her being alive still.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What about a secret path that we can maybe get through to avoid some of these people? Was kind of wondering if he's lying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can press him that information even harder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey guys, we should press him for information about this passage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a couple of more questions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I start speaking to him in Underdark?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am good tonight, you guys

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does Underdark sound like, by the way? (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's kind of reminiscent of Black Speech from the Tolkien universe, that has that guttural (speaking Black Speech) very, very deep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (gasps) Vex, what are you doing? What is this coming out of your mouth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh noes, hold on, hold on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got your paper today? Lovely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. He says, "No passages to the stronghold, but there is a way in. Aside from the front. Good "luck getting up in there from that point."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, through the lake. Deep below, you'll find a tunnel. This tunnel will lead you to a "subterranean passage straight to the stronghold."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we check to make sure he's not untruthful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's bullshitting through his teeth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, he seemed honest about the passage but dishonest about the-- he's basically following her lead. "Uh-huh."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell us true, where is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If I tell you, will you let me live?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can lock him up. And then kill him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't just leave me alive. Give me a chance to walk from this building, "on my own, arms intact."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And I'll give you the secret entrance to Emberhold itself, "leading you straight within the throne room."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we have to leave you alive, and let you leave this building intact?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I get to keep this as a souvenir.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I actually think this is an appropriate moment to play with a bit of banditry. I say we take everything from him and he can make his way out all on his own.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As is his undergarments on for--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't care to see that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we take him with us? Just in casies--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, a cold, clammy hand touches your shoulder and pulls you aside as--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- a partially hooded Clarota steps forward and says, "I'll attempt to read his surface "thoughts. If he tries to keep it from me, I'll know."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he steps forward, he puts one hand in front of him and his eyes gleam with a sickly green hue. You can see the general tips his head back for a second and begins twitching an eye. Sweat begins to bead around his brow as Clarota takes another step forward, tensing his hand once more, his head beginning to bow forward with an intensity, a force of focus towards his direction. You can now see the general, "Let me live. Let me go and I'll tell you. This isn't necessary. I'm willing to "give you the information." You can see a trickle of blood begin to pour out of one of his nostrils.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does he know anything about K'varn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me see." And the mind flayer pushes once more into his brain. You see a twitch to his face as his head kind of lolls back and rolls for a second, resisting as best he can. But his will is currently being beaten by the defeat of the battle, the lack of his compatriot mind flayer, and the sheer intensity of Clarota now focused on vengeance and returning to his people. The blood beings to stream not just from his nostrils, but from his ears as well. As Clarota releases him for a second, he goes, "He has not seen K'varn, but knows a bit of his nature. I cannot read it, but we could press for more information."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should just ask him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- next to Clarota, push the dwarf against the wall, and say, our friend here is not as patient as I am. We want to know about this K'varn, and we want you and all your men, all your little mates here, to throw your weapons into the chasm, you can go fuck off, but we want to know everything. And this is your last chance. Right now, right here. Talk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you have to get naked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) And you have to get naked.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Will you stop with the naked? Grog--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's starting to become a thing now. I'm just saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "K'varn was responsible for forging the alliance. For centuries and generations, his "people and mine killed and fought. It wasn't until K'varn came that we decided to work together for a "common cause. Expansion, unification, dominion over this land and these mountains. Divided, we "were weak, petty, greedy. With K'varn leading us, we have purpose, we have growth. We could take "what we'd like, and I'm but one dwarf. If I fall over here, "many more will take over where I fell."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we can see that's obviously worked out really well for you. I think that I'm satisfied, are you satisfied?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of creature is K'varn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Insight check for me as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would I recognize this creature he's describing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a nature check. Or arcana, either one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you can make one yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. No natural creature you've ever heard has this type of essence to it, having a single black horn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an awful, awful narwhal. Way to spoil the story, Liam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gnashing teeth, black horn, very intelligent. That doesn't seem to be anything from nature itself. From your experience, there are different entities, but usually there are multiple horns. Singular, demonic beings that would have extreme intelligence, sharp teeth, horns, and you've had brief brushes in the past with demonic entities that seems to run in a similar vein, but nothing in particular is creeping into mind. It's going to be difficult for you to specifically come up with this, with what little information you currently have. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should let him go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's take his-- We take Grog's handcuffs out of his bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me-- That was not the deal! You leave me, unspoiled, on my life, "and I tell you the way into Emberhold."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Take the hammer. That's rough on him. Leave his armor on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You haven't told us yet, have you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We already told you your weapons are ours.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In fact, we'll be keeping your weapons, your armor, and I believe, your pride.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You may even outrun the dwarves we're about to set free.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice! Percy's fucked-up tonight, I like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He tried to make a book out of someone's flesh once.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait. He's telling us, shut up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Emberhold is the fortress of our people, built to resist assault from all sides."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two streams of molten rock that pour "down the side. The smaller of those two streams covers a secret tunnel."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Insight check. Is he full of shit? I rolled-- Oh, nothing too hot at all. Never mind, forget it. Forget I said anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've done my side of the bargain. Let me free."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stepping behind, I take my knife, and I cut his belt loose and let his pants fall, and I give him a little nudge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're free to go. Not toward your stronghold, but towards the surface.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is wearing full plate black armor--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So his trousers do not plummet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't we have Scanlan turn him into a porpoise?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think so. No, that's mine. As a token to remember you by.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's great. You can really argue all you want to, or I'll just smash your fucking head in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We said you were alive, your weapons were ours. What, have you got shit in your ears?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Which I was totally fine with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes a couple of steps forward towards you, holding the warhammer out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly, he turns completely invisible, vanishes from sight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My perception's really high, can I try to find him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just let him go, it's all he's got.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's all he's got right now. He's naked, and now he's invisible running through a cavern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- he becomes visible again, about 20 feet out, gone down the stairs and towards the front door and he just--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm throwing a dagger at him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I'm throwing my ax at him with the chain of returning as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh good, that's great. 28 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a Sneak Attack, just damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You chuck your ax at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so go ahead and roll damage for both of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is there, standing in place with his arms locked like this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten damage, all right. There's now a significant amount of blood beginning to pool down his feet, as he's standing there. As he is frozen in place, Clarota just kinda steps up to the front of him, grabs his cheeks and pulls his head in towards him, as his tendrils slowly wrap around his head. You can see them meet at the back of his skull, and with this horrible crunching sound, you see his head shudder, as his limbs go limp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few moments of this horrible slurping sound--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- and you hear this dull, sickening, hollow (suction) sound. The tentacles release, Clarota releases his grip from his head, and the captain falls onto his back, a giant bloodied hole in the center of his skull.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess you should've left the hammer, shouldn't you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some people are terrible losers, just really terrible.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to loot the body.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, well. Yeah, we definitely do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to pick up the hammer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is a good lesson, to no one else that's watching.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Clarota, that was incredible. Well done!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one is watching this valuable lesson.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Know when you've lost your clothes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was that actually, like, a meal for you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're looking, you can see there's that kind of weird purplish crimson around his tendrils, as he kinda wipes it off with his hands, and goes, "It's enough to sustain me a while. I was getting hungry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. Better him than us, I say.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Me, I'm just an appetizer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, so you loot the body. You find amongst all the duergar bodies here, as you're quickly jumping around and grabbing, it's hard to count the exact amount, but you're looking at somewhere in the neighbourhood of about five to six hundred gold pieces. You'll have to check later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A series of black iron weapons. None of them seem to, at a quick glance, have any sort of magical value. The blackened plate armor on the duergar itself does radiate a magical essence, as does the warhammer he was holding.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tiberius, can you tell us anything about these things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what is in here, that would be 11 sets, total.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'd say Grog should have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because there were also sets that were on the rack at the very front.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Grog about to get a new weapon?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I'll do an arcana check, right? An arcana check on the stuff?

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna Hawkeye you out at some point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you do a magical check on the-- Oh, he's got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as Tiberius is looking over the equipment, kind of poring through his arcane knowledge.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, oh, ooh! I think Pike and Grog would benefit from these, most definitely. Here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it? What was it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's not any kind of dark magic about the armor, is there?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I mean, it's dark in color.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But it's, you know, your standard arcana magic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Clarota, so when you eat their brains, do you also get their thoughts, maybe?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh! The heavy plate armor has resistance to fire damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Or it's just-- it's gone after that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are residual memories, thoughts. It's delicious." And you can see, there's this almost rapturous look in his face you haven't seen before. For a moment, Clarota looks a little younger, a little stronger, a little more dangerous. And you're put off a little bit by it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But there's kind of this momentary kind of relishing in the moment and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need to give you a moment alone? We can leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He speaks the truth about the path into the Emberhold."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, he spoke of some sort of trap door that's easy to open from within, but not from outside, correct?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was hidden by a lava flow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On the left side of the keep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Can I ask a question?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there a lot of other soldiers still in the camp, or did we--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, there are plenty of soldiers still in the camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit! We should've kept him alive, you guys! Okay, okay, okay. Yes, Grog?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, he was about to walk out the door and cause mayhem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. He was gonna alert everybody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I harvest any natural armor from the bulette? The kitty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try and start cleaving away at it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, yes, I start butchering, or something, the bulette.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, 'cause you tried to cut through before and you managed to make a few marks. It takes you a few minutes. You manage to get, let's say, about three saucer-shaped pieces of armor out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could definitely get more, but then you start hearing bells going off.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What do I see? I'm still on the roof.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, we should all-- Can we all--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see anything yet. You just hear bells starting to go off in the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should just get out of here. Keyleth, can you fucking eagle up and let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to free those dwarves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Big horns. You start seeing torches being lit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stealth, stealth. And get out. Go stealth and get out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to get out, now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh guys, the jig is up!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I shoot my grapple thing and go up out of the ceiling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We just need to get out the way we came in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without A Trace. Everyone stand near me. And I'll turn into an eagle and I scoop up the gnomes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what's the radius on Pass Without A Trace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four miles, it's all I got.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I take the dust of tracelessness out of the bag of holding and I sprinkle it around the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we grapple up out from the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the arrow that you have that he made, it's essentially an arrow that bursts into a tanglefoot bag. When it bursts, it grapples whoever's there, it's not like grappling an arrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's not like a string arrow, although I'll build that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought it was like a grappling--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll make you a grappling arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a grappling hook. Yeah, we should grapple out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30-foot radius, okay, so you could just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- barely get Tiberius in there if you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can go on my back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm gonna jump on Grog's back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and I pick up Scanlan under my arm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a regular grappling hook, we'll just get up out of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Scanlan-- Both gnomes get grabbed by Keyleth as--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And we're all on the carpet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The carpet's away, but this guy is flying?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am? I thought we were all-- Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you can't go on the carpet. You're too heavy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Up and out. Can we stealth, while we do it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you guys, right now, as you're carrying the two gnomes, all of you except for Grog are on the carpet, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're flying. Okay, so how many spells do you have left on that? One left? All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trinket's back on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's back on the other side. Trinket didn't come with you to the battle, because there was nobody to get Trinket across.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he's just on the other side by himself, all lonely?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You weren't here to protect your bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone, make a stealth check. With a plus ten additional modifier thanks to Keyleth's spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you all take off. As you do, you can see now, probably close to 30 or 40 duergar have now begun rushing towards the barracks in the center of that main open area where that wooden platform was, where Scanlan originally saw a mind flayer. As you rush up, you hear (speaks Undercommon). You hear it as Undercommon, screaming, "There! Above, look!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe you should scream, like, no, they went the other way!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just keep going up, up, up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A stream of javelins comes firing up in your direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did they see us? I thought we were stealthed.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I see where it's coming and I shoot a Fireball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so there's a volley of javelins and a Fireball streaking past. You'll be able to get ten of them in that Fireball blast, go ahead and roll for damage on that. However, for those that rolled less than 20 on stealth, each of you are getting three javelins each to you. So that's you two, and Grog. What'd you roll again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 14 points of piercing damage as the javelin just gleans off the side of your giant eagle torso.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, 24 points total, as three javelins-- Two strike you off the shoulders and one actually embeds itself partway into your waist and you have to pull it out, and probably dug a good six, seven inches in.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: By the way, 41 points of fire damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, we healed the other game. Even with that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, the three that are going towards Grog--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That-- Natural 20. A 17, what's your AC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one misses, and the last one-- Yeah, two natural 20s.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good thing you got a thousand hit points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the point of a meat tank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a total of 36 points of piercing damage, Grog.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And he still has more hitpoints than we do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If Scanlan were here, he'd moon and blind all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is here, Scanlan's holding on tight as--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, as the javelins strike all you guys, moments later there's a gargantuan explosion, and there's a flash of reddish light from below. A giant fiery blooming explosion bursts into the center of that area. You can see duergar thrown left and right. You manage to take out about 12 of them in that one blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can now see more and more are starting to gather, the bells are going off, the horns are blowing hard. You can see a bunch of them are now running over to what looks like some of this siege equipment they had constructed--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which includes a few large ballistae.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we should friggin' dive bomb towards the far tunnel past this war camp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is fine, he's hiding out. They don't know he's here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm not concerned with the bear right now!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going to dive. Yes, dive bomb, dive bomb!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The bear can take care of himself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take hold of the front of the carpet and steer it up and over, along the roof and then down towards the tunnel. I'm steering the carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys are coming down. You basically shot up, curved around--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you're going backwards towards the barracks. As you do, another volley of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We got to free those dwarves, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another volley comes to the guys who were under-stealthed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't have to. That seems complicated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, there is one attack less each because of the duergar that you had taken out. So, against Keyleth, one hits. You take 12 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am no longer an eagle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, a two and a one versus Percy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hit zero hit points as an eagle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's not an eagle and she's falling with the gnomes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth's form shifts back into that of Keyleth. You guys are about 80 feet up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, both Scanlan and Pike go into a free fall along with Keyleth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, she was on Grog, she was--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we under them? Are we under them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys are about parallel. You guys were moving together.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As we dive right under them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you guys are out in the middle of the open cavern. There's no place to connect the bridge, so you're essentially creating a giant ice--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chunk right beneath them. Which is also now in freefall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys try and swoop underneath as they're plummeting-- You're riding this, go ahead and make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I didn't think of that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know what to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we try to catch-- can we try to-- what do I have?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we over the war camp, or are we over the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you swoop underneath. A sudden motion, as you're trying to cast. Go ahead and roll a concentration check on this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, save my life, again, Tiberius.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I let go of the front of the carpet, I stick a--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, can I cast War God's Blessing to give him a plus ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like (worried noise), you're just plummeting through the air like a rock because you're in full plate armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use the rope of endless twine and try to lasso one of them? 'Cause I'm really a good shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to pull it out of the bag of holding and then turn into a lasso, that's gonna take you a full minute, so you don't have time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a rope. I let go of the front of the carpet, I put one end of the rope in my sister's hand, and I jump off towards Pike, holding it around in one hand as I go--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I grapple onto her to hold her down.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! No, no, no, I have so much armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right guys, so here's what happens. In the time this has transpired, you've rushed underneath with the magic carpet, all of you barely managed to hold on, as both Pike and Scanlan and Keyleth all slam into the top of the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh okay, except you're dangling off of it now by a rope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, wait, we slam into the top of what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys slam onto the top of the rest of the group, in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's too many people on the carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The carpet now has too much weight and is currently giving out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Get me close to him. I cast Featherfall on you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's slowing your fall, but you guys are-- you're coming down at a very, very fast pace at an angle over the barracks towards the back end of the war camp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I cast Wind Wall right underneath of the carpet to kind of like airbend us up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I begin to fart to slow the fall.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Who needs Featherfall? I can do it in a bunch!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Re-explain what's happening. So the carpet is falling, not as fast as it would, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, you guys are flying beside each other, the three that were falling, you guys swooped underneath and caught them, however it's too much weight to bear, the carpet's now--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How high are we at this second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this second, you're about 60-70 feet up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the closest building, the highest building under us is how tall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, however, goes into a full plummet. You guys have just caught the rest of them, you've all caught them, you're crashing down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And did the Wind Wall thing work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a concentration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody jump up in the air!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Unpause. How far are we from the tunnel that we were talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can see here, you're probably about 50 to 60 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're right over the camp, aren't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're towards the back of it, thankfully, the barracks are towards the back of it, so maybe about 50 to 60 feet from the full tunnel.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Before where the drop is, and that's where that bottom tunnel is down there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys go crashing at an angle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to brace to jump. I'm bracing to roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm grabbing for Pike and going like this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You leap off of the carpet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an acrobatics check. With a disadvantage, because you are jumping off of a currently flimsy flying carpet to try and catch up to him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Right now, while I'm doing this, I'm going to cast Featherfall on myself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, before, you gotta get to me first, because it will slow you too much.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. It would, wouldn't it? I thought it was only when going down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gotta get to me first, motherfucker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's your acrobatics check? The lower of the two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You manage to fumble out of the carpet, however, you are now just end-over-end falling now off of the side of the carpet on your own.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The world's just spinning and spinning and spinning.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Now I'm going to cast Featherfall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead, cast and roll concentration check. What did you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He rolled a 19. Which is good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In that time, Grog has impacted.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're gonna hit, we're gonna hit. I'm shielding the healer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you all brace for impact. The actual carpet's careening out of control. You can see there's just barely the top of a building you might be able to try and skim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we jump onto the top of the building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just managed to skim the edge, which lessens your impact slightly, however, it does send you all into a full end-over-end topple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god. Which one to roll, which one to roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, no. What's going on with Grog?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I guess that's what we'll find out afterwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog's impacted. He was falling faster than you guys were, he's six hundred pounds going into straight freefall. You guys had a little bit of a fall break.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, this is going terribly! I'm failing!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Do I have to do one also?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone. Oh, except for you, because you're floating.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do the halflings-- Shit! Do the gnomes get an advantage since the half-elves are protecting them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's based on how you guys roll, because you're the ones who are holding onto them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Welp, Scanlan. I'm sorry to let you know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I have a plus nine acrobatics! Plus nine acrobatics!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't matter on a natural crit fail.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all right, I got the healer, I got the healer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're gonna be like an ACME cartoon and just leave a (pff)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He didn't have a lot of hit points left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This the second time Grog's almost fallen to his death.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 points of damage to you. The rest of you all take 36 points of fall damage, except for Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody? As a group, like we all failed as a group?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, no, sorry. You succeeded, you rolled a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, so you would also take half-damage, so you would take 18 as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take half that as well, thanks to his roll as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Everybody in this club getting hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, you were in full plummet, you can reduce the damage slightly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I was very graceful on the way down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you take 45 points of damage from the impact, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And leave a small crater from the impact.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what, that could've been worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You and Scanlan both take 36, which puts Scanlan into a negative as well, because he wasn't-- he was not at--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no! He was fully healed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you all tumble end over end, come to rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We just crash-landed in a war camp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. On the far end of it, thankfully.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can hear the bells and the horns going in the distance. It looks like all the rest of the folks that were stationed here moved towards the center. You managed to arc over them, but they're going to be here shortly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we near their big war machines?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the ballistae are on the opposite--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So we can see the ledge and that cavern where we were, where we found the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the ledge is back in the other direction. You guys are going towards the tunnel on the opposite side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax is pulling up Pike onto her feet and dragging her towards Scanlan, 'cause I know how fucked up he was from the last battle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you guys-- and you, you're kinda getting up on your knees, coughing--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's just face-down in the ground, scrapes across the side of his face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about-- I'll give him a level three potion and you go heal Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you, here, you take care of him, I'm right next to Scanlan,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are roughly about ten feet from each other from the impact, just, you were scattered, and then you kind of regrouped.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Can we see people running towards us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet, but you assume it's only a short period of time.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, we have some time left--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You barely get yourself out of the crater. That's gonna suck tomorrow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You take Scanlan, I'll take Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is happening, Percy, go ahead and make a death saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a fail, so mark off one fail on your death saving throw on your sheet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got a healing potion and I'm pouring it--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pinching Percy's nose and pouring it in his mouth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm pouring some down Scanlan's throat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all right. So both you guys pour healing potions. That is-- those are the normal ones? The common? The regular healing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! So I'm at plus eight now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the cheapest one you've got. 2d4 + 2.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get the fuck out of here and they can--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She was gonna do a Mass Healing--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, what's your Mass Healing Word?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'd like to know-- on the way down, I was doing a little chant and I was expending my sorcery points to do Flexible Casting, so I regain a slot spell on my third-level spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As we're getting up, can I see-- Is the camp nearby, where the prisoners are? Is that anywhere near us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's towards the center of the camp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We gotta keep moving. I pull out another corked potion and slap it into Percy's hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then grab him by the wrist and just start walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, wait. Save the potion, I cast Healing Word on Percy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hold on, I'm gonna do a Mass Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as you guys are running towards the back, towards the main tunnel, which you can now see, it's roughly a 40- by 30-foot tunnel. You go running through the buildings. You see a few duergar kinda poke out from the buildings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we stealth while we're doing this, or are we too, like, injured?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not even concentrating on stealth right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus, with the group-- Basically, a few of you would stealth and the rest of you would be left in the dust, so you're just kind of all pushing for speed at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all manage to push towards the back of the entire war camp, into this tunnel. Hearing behind you the distant echoing shouts of approximately 30-plus duergar heading in your direction. You hear a few other ballista bolts hitting the wall above you of the stone.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we all in the tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have now pushed into the tunnel.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I wait for everybody to pass and I cast all my Grand Columns.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three per spell? And how many spell levels do you have currently?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's it, that's what I did the SP for, so that I could cast this right now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have none in my column.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. How many spell castings did you have left? Two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One left. So you get three columns. It's 30 feet wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, she just healed everybody for 24 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, everyone heals for 24 points. Add that up.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are the caves stone? Like the cave--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I like, do it from the side? Can I attempt to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pillars go straight up, unfortunately. It's the nature of the spell's creation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well wait, I can do what you're trying to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! So as you're trying to figure this out, Keyleth steps over--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like, oh, is this, oh--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry! You should've just-- I would've-- they're not very--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we running? I don't know what you guys are doing. What's happening right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are doing this and rushing in, you're realizing there's one member of your party that you haven't had a lot of time with--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- that you didn't think about until this moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now see, kind of, like, floating, via levitation ability, about 30 feet away, slowly descending towards you, as you're putting up the wall of stone--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two bolts go firing towards him; one whooshes overhead, a second one--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact sound) -- through his back, out the front of his chest--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Come on! We need to save him!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's gotta have more than ten hit points.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Recess the wall, recess the wall!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see now-- and the bolt itself is about 4 feet long, made of this long, jagged, pointed arrow tip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clarota begins to falter, and begins to hover towards you, almost, like, trying to swim through the air in your direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we run out, try to grab him?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I grab him, hang on to him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's about 20 feet from you now, you can try and reach out and put your hands towards him--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take off and run to him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Now I cast Glacial Blast, right under him, like a slide, right towards us-- and catch him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you guys are running towards him, instead, this giant crystalline form of ice just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- as it descends, two more bolts come towards him. Both (whoosh, whoosh). At this distance, in the darkness of the cavern, it's kind of hard for them to get a bead on him. Both just pass overhead. With eyes kind of lolling, Clarota comes down and hits the edge of the slide, and almost loses consciousness at that moment, sliding through the ice. You guys manage to capture, grappling his arms, lift him to his feet--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all make it into the tunnel, Keyleth turns around, raising her hands, the actual blackened stonework of this tunnel shakes for a second, and then a giant, thick wall of natural rock closes off the entire tunnel behind you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Completely seals it. You guys are now in complete darkness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the light hits, you can hear, just on the other side of the surface of the stone wall, javelins, other things are being shot at the stone wall--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- but it's keeping it at bay. You guys are now at the wall, and behind you the tunnel continues into a passage you haven't seen yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They could have magic in their possession, they could use magic as well, so let's move.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they could get through it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Will a healing potion work on Clarota?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I go over to Clarota and try to heal him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't get too close, he might just suck in your brain.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we give him a potion?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I do have a cask, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I need a drink.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's a level two potion do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A level two potion would be 4d4 + 4.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go and hold his shoulders--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- whilst she tries to heal him, just in case he gets all sucky on her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think he's gonna give him a potion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The arrow is still stuck in its torso.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we try to pull it out?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Try to break off the part--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a-- this would be a medicine check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you wanna do that, Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Breaking it off is not gonna work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to pull it from the wound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You take your moment, you view up where the puncture wound is, with a little bit of Grog's help, you both grab the edge, and you're like, 'On three. One, two, three, pull!' You pull through the wound, not against the arrow--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- 'cause that would just tear everything out in the process, but nevertheless, in doing so, Clarota does take an additional eight points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But, the wound is now no longer a giant--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- it's now able to be healed completely, so. Clarota takes a moment and kind of grasps the wound.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hand him a little healing potion, and say, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shatters the glass. At which point, you now hear (impact sounds) against the stone wall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pick up Clarota. Yeah, why not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pick up Clarota and we start running balls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he good enough to walk or is he--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, how about I put one arm under his face and help him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that's-- hold on a second. I take out the flying carpet--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We still have the flying carpet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should've gone down! What were we thinking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he said go down. We didn't go down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 13 for me. I like how my passive perception is way higher than any rolls that I ever do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do keep that-- I keep tabs on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we all doing perception rolls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most part, we've got a few rolls, and it worked fine. Looking inside though, this camp looks like it's been abandoned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it was built, and then the expansion into the war camp you just escaped from seemed to be the next step. Like it's slowly advancing and this section of it has been in disuse. As you push in towards the center of the camp you can see there's older campfires, lots of the tents have like partially collapsed. Dust has gathered.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm keeping my eyes peeled for useful shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you're looking straight from the direction you came, there is one right ahead of you, a little bit to the left and one that goes quickly to the left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we take the left one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so maybe we should stay left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Clarota, do you know anything about these passages?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, why did he say that? Why did you say that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Cause they're both kind of left. It's a joke. Clarota takes a moment and kind of looks at you, kind of-- his breath. "I've not been this far up these tunnels. It's too dangerous this close to "the war camp. I would've been killed in a second."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about the general's memory? Anything there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "One of these leads below, one of them leads to "the surface. I can't recall which."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, can we go next to the one on the far left and see if I sense any like wind coming down, is there--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Going to the one on the far left, as you're stepping you hear a (muffled impact noise)--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- against the distant stone wall that you put up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we get to pick one here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you head to the tunnel, you don't sense any sort of temperature change, but it does seem to steady off into a decline that curves to the left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you mean, are there like-- is there any wildlife, any bats, any type of animals, anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We shall say, a general sense of this area, you look and you can see, in this area, unlike the previous sections, there are small clusters of bats on the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As apparently they have an exit of some kind to the surface.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and cast Beast Sense on one of the bats.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm going to channel myself through the bat and I'm going to make him fly down the far left tunnel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you guys are walking over there, one of the bats--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- heads down into the tunnel, continues into the darkness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the echolocation, which is a very strange sensation, you haven't really done this before for a bat and it's a very weird experience.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, guys, this is really trippy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It continues about a steady 40-degree decline that goes further and further down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep going down. Down, down, down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you get to a point where the bat is out of your sphere of influence and you lose your connection to the bat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I didn't really see much, but definitely there is a pretty steep incline. We could try it again and go down the other one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we keep going down. Just stick with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, then let's go with the decline. Yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With stealth! With Dust of Tracelessness behind us.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And one's smaller than the other?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no right answer here. It's just--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How big is the-- how wide is the smaller one that we're going through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's one, the one on the far end, the one that does not appear to be a decline, seems to be the widest of the two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pull out a torch. Will you light my torch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we going to the left?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take off running to the left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog goes charging into the darkened tunnel to the very left--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna take off after him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The heavy footsteps of Grog disappearing into the darkness--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We take off after him, 'cause he needs help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, Grog! Don't run too far ahead-- He's gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys catch up to Grog, which isn't too hard--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to a full sprint, though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, no. I mean. A leisurely jog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. You catch up to Grog. The tunnel itself is about 30 feet wide, 20 feet tall. And it is a slow, continuously gradual decline and curve to the left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we could do a cave-in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This alcove, it's about 35, 40 feet in, and it looks like there are remnants here of a camp that was set up once. Similar to the war camp, but once again abandoned, or at least currently not in use.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we go, oh! Can we go in? We should probably rest, heal up, get our spells back. Can you cast the illusion terrain and make it look like there's no hole in the cavern here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I can't, today. I'm sorry.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: If this is where we're gonna be chilling, I can seal off that tunnel still.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we have to be able to get back out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No! If you seal off the passage, right, we keep going down, and if that's a dead end-- it's probably not-- if it is, can't we rest and use the same spell to open it up?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But we would just have Grog hack away at it for a while--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It can be, you know, destroyed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They do call me 'Grog the Locksmith.'

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we go in and look at the camp and see, like, stealthily--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- check out what the camp is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make it really foggy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigate check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, we know that about you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about in the game, though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make it look like a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this conversation, Vex does a quick glance over, there are about four tents that are still set up, there appears to be a small ring where a fire was set up, and you can see kind of bits of charcoal--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- and bits of long, long, long forgotten burnt meat, remnants, charcoal, and such there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna look for a seal, to see if there's a seal anywhere around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see, on one of the walls--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- there is a similar seal of Bahamut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, there are four tents here--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which means-- previously you saw just one, from what you saw. There are four here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an interesting change to your appearance. Means either been repurposed, or there were more people with her, or since then the tent, the camp has been used by other individuals aside from her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, glancing through, you do notice that there are a few discarded travel bags--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- carrying rope, grappling hooks, general cluster of torches, about eight in total--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, that's nice. Torch, torch, torch, torch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you! Bag of holding, bag of holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you glance about you can see, in this alcove, looking at the dirt itself, it looks like there was a serious struggle. You can start seeing drag mark--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use Tracking and see what happened, like Prince Humperdink, please? Can do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, well, this is part of your investigation roll, essentially.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unless you want to track to where the tracks went, that's a different story. That's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, can I see who was attacked first? Does it look like Kima was attacked, or she--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell, you see some of the footsteps, and some of the drag marks, while mostly worn over, elements do show some of the fairer folk. The duergar have a very distinct footprint or size. You do see one that resembles more of, like, gnomish or halfling origin. You see drag marks in the dirt, you see other individuals, looks like there were chunks of rock that have been chopped off the side of the wall that look fresh, where you can see the soot that has settled into this part of the cavern is no longer visible where these scratch marks basically took off and exposed fresh rock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The drag marks, do they lead outside of the alcove and down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do, and they lead down the tunnel further.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go that way, or are we resting?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need to rest? I mean--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- I feel like we need to get our spells back, otherwise we're just gonna get killed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we being chased right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are people hot on our tail?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I guess that's the best thing to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm totally fine at the moment, so I'll stay awake too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe seal the tunnel behind us, yeah, so that--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- if they do come, they have to like, try to get through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can stay, I can stay awake too, I'm okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you use your spell, you seal off the tunnel with pillars. You can just barely get most of the entranceway covered, there's a couple of small slivers and spaces between.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But we would sure hear them, if they were--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys end up making camp, are you guys lighting a fire? Or are you keeping it dark? What's your plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I've got two firewood bundles in the bag of Ikea holding.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think we need a fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think it's a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're fine. It's warm down here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've got Tiberius, if he's awake, can cast Light, let's just go into one of these tents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can keep burning a torch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can each have our own tent! There's enough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anything made of wood down here?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I actually have to rest completely, so I can't do shifts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to set it on fire.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I need all my spell slots.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need to sleep as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What wood there is, is used charcoal in the abandoned fire pit, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out some dice, so that Grog and I can gamble while everyone are sleeping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much does a rest heal? Out of curiosity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A rest heals you to full.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, sweet! Yeah, let's fully rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I have time to do a quick engineering feat, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like at this point, I mean, you could-- what're you trying to do? I should say.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Make an explosive arrow. I'm just in a mood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have any currently built explosives?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what, I'll let you go ahead and try it with just your tinker's kit--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do I add? Am I just straight roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You add your proficiency bonus, which is, the tinker's kit is four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay, okay. You manage to fasten what appears to be a black powder, impact-based explosive to the tip of an arrow. It's a little weighty and unwieldy, it might not be the most accurate thing in the world, but if it hits it's probably gonna pack a punch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the best day ever!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I gingerly put it in my quiver.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll get better. It'll get better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you make me an explosive axe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You very gingerly place it within your quiver.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think you want an explosive axe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one of those things where, you know, shooting it is going to be an interesting challenge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I keep it away from the rest of my stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a possibility it could explode just--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You haven't even played with your hammer yet!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very unlikely to explode on by itself. 'Cause it needs to be moving at a high speed. But it's just not the best thing ever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I won't keep it straight behind my head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's just kind of keep it down at my waist--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The next one will be better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Did we all rest? Are we all rested?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the evening transpires, you all get your evenings of rest, you guys kind of keeping watch, gambling away. At a certain point, throughout the evening, something perks up your ears. You begin hearing footsteps, many footsteps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh no. How many is many? A lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many does it sound like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sounds like anywhere between six, ten, more--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From, right, from up? Or down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well like the-- no, no, no. From like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up the path you guys came from.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Grog and I are the only ones awake, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog and I are the only ones awake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we lay low, and hold quiet in these tents? Or do we get everyone up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're gonna know, 'cause we blocked off the friggin' path! I'm asleep. Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no, no, I rouse my sister quietly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Leaving the rest asleep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The three of you make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should stop rolling this fucking dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Yeah, that was a one. This, by the way--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- was given to me by Wil Wheaton.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- and then you woke her up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point? You weren't resting?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because I was, I was still at full--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're not resting you don't get your spells back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: -- I fell asleep! I totally forgot. I am sound asleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She dreamed, in the dream she was still awake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are welcome to stay awake if you want, but you just won't get your spells back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was dreaming, it was real--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: -- I was so confused, by my dream.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were just going all Inception on us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, when you can't fall asleep--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- and you're like, am I dreaming? Or is this the dream? Or is it real?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spin the top. Spin the top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you wake up, and you have to pee, it's hard to tell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So the three of us are up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. Between the three of you, thankfully, you had two successes against one failure. You manage to cover for your sister--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no, that was a bad expression!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Did eyebrows go up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whistles In the Hall of the Mountain King)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The footsteps progress through, and you-- there's no light source, as duergar for the most part do not require light to see in the tunnels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see through the dark-- but we can see in the dark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have low-light vision, not dark vision.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no light in this area at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is pitch black. You just hear--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- you just hear the footprints go by.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good thing we didn't make a campfire!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear them approach the outskirts of the alcove.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have dark vision, gosh dang it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, when the footfalls dissipate, and silence once again takes the camp, you breathe a sigh of relief and remove your hand from Vex's face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, maybe just leave it there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Last time I did that I got kicked in the nuts, very hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. Eventually, when you feel enough time has passed, where those who've been resting come from their sleep, spells recovered, wounds are healed, except for those who didn't sleep, you guys maintain the same health you had previously.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What a good sleep I've had! I have all my spells back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one level of exhaustion on both of you currently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. So what does that do to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just means any ability checks you take--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, any skills you take are at disadvantage until you get a full night's rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take one more level two potion right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You can use-- remember, you can use your hit dice to heal still, before you start throwing potions around. If you have a moment to rest--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hit dice. We forgot about that because it wasn't there before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. (sings) Fifth Edition! Before you start throwing potions around, 'cause remember, you're far away from civilization right now, you have a very limited number of potions now to lead you through here, unless you find some way to return to the surface.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You all eventually come back to consciousness, in this darkened alcove, pitch black. It is still warm, slight smell of soot and dust in the air, what do you guys want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Outside of existence. Tiberius put up a stone, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I didn't hear any (impact sounds), right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, they just kind of passed by our alcove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It basically matched the wall as you guys went around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. So we sealed ourselves into this little pocket?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. We didn't even friggin' need to hide in the tent! We were in a little bubble of air!

lines.name: LAURA

The best you could find yourself any sort of comfort here is from whatever you have on your back. Most of you sleep in your armor out of necessity and paranoia. As consciousness comes to you, you guys are able to try and find your way back out now that you've been sealed in.
